content: quote: Originally posted by BPCR45_90: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: "http://gatewaypundit.blogspot.com/2009/03/obama-popularity-plunges-down-22-points.html" The highly accurate poll subtracts the ‘strong dissapprovals’ from the ‘strong approvals’ to get their net approval rating. The week Barack Obama was sworn in, the ‘Obama Approval Index’ his approval rate was a whopping 30%. By March 1 to a meager 8%. Considering he had 15% on February 27, this is a veritable freefall. "Highly accurate" my azz. What a load of BS! Obama's already high approval rating went up a bit to 68% during his 6 weeks in office, according to the bipartisan NBC News / Wall Street Journal poll released yesterday(3/3/09). Thursday, March 05, 2009 Rasmussen Reports daily Presidential Tracking Poll for Thursday shows that 41% of the nation’s voters now Strongly Approve of the way that Barack Obama is performing his role as President. Twenty-seven percent (27%) Strongly Disapprove to give Obama a Presidential Approval Index rating of +14 (see trends). Thirty-five percent (35%) of voters now say the nation is heading in the right direction. That’s up from 30% a week ago and 28% the week before. Seventy-two percent (72%) of Democrats Strongly Approve of the President’s performance while 52% of Republicans Strongly Disapprove. Voters not affiliated with either major party are fairly evenly divided (see other recent demographic highlights). The Presidential Approval Index is calculated by subtracting the number who Strongly Disapprove from the number who Strongly Approve. It is updated daily at 9:30 a.m. Eastern (sign up for free daily e-mail update). Updates also available on Twitter. Please take a moment to predict where the President’s Approval Index ratings will be at the end of his first 100 days in office. Overall, 59% of voters say they at least somewhat approve of the President’s performance so far while 40% disapprove. For more measures, see Obama By the Numbers. Thirty-five percent (35%) of voters now say the nation is heading in the right direction. That’s up from 30% a week ago and 28% the week before. Seventy-two percent (72%) of Democrats Strongly Approve of the President’s performance while 52% of Republicans Strongly Disapprove. Voters not affiliated with either major party are fairly evenly divided (see other recent demographic highlights). The Presidential Approval Index is calculated by subtracting the number who Strongly Disapprove from the number who Strongly Approve. content: It seems to me, Obama is facing the international test (or crisis) that Biden predicted would happen! He has three "Leaky Boats" (for the lack of a better methpor) to deal with! - One Leaky Boat is the U.S. Economy and the Loss of Jobs. - This President is doing nothing (except making the leaks worse) to improve this situation. - Potential INVESTORS in our markets and/or new businesses cannot find any reason to have confidence in any of Obama's actions. - The President "Talks Down" the American Economy for whatever reason. No reason for Investor confidence on that situation. - To date, all of Obama's proposals offer little reason for Investor confidence - literally no tax breaks for businesses owners and/or potential EMPLOYERS. The second "leaky boat" is the United States Stature or Prestige abroad. - Many allied countries had invested in the United States' markets and banks. - Those investors have LOST HEAVILY. - Nothing, relating to solving that part of the crisis, is happening. - Those Nations are "Pi##ed at America and rightfully so! - Sec of State Clinton quickly traveled to Japan and China to try to "quiet" their complaints. She's doing the same in Europe and Russia. - This Presidental "letter Writing" to Russia is highly unusual and "Smells of Appeasement." Appeasement with our Enemies is not going to bring us better PROTECTION or Security. Appeasement will cause our ememies to hold America in "MORE CONTEMPT and demand more concessions from us! - Other Nations Have No Confidence" in the LARGE STIMULUS (e.g., Spending Bill) we just placed on our Children to pay back! The third leaky boat is: - the crisis on our border with Mexico. - this is a grave threat to America's security. - The Administration, if they are really doing any thing of importance, to quell or stop this; it's not being disclosed! Instead, Obama seems to be pushing health care reform (that we can do without change right now) and planning parties at the White House! Those that choose to ADMIRE him will continue with their right to do so! Me; I'll proudly continue to oppose him; for those reasons mentioned above and NUMEROUS other reasons! All are my opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran

content: quote: Originally posted by JustanotherGI: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by shades_of_grey: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by SignalSgtWilliams: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: "http://gatewaypundit.blogspot.com/2009/03/obama-popularity-plunges-down-22-points.html" The highly accurate poll subtracts the ‘strong dissapprovals’ from the ‘strong approvals’ to get their net approval rating. The week Barack Obama was sworn in, the ‘Obama Approval Index’ his approval rate was a whopping 30%. By March 1 to a meager 8%. Considering he had 15% on February 27, this is a veritable freefall. Sort of like our economy, that he can not fix. I'm still waiting for change. The only change I've seen is from real bad to worse. Maybe that's his plan.......... And the Republicans have no plan (but the one that hasn't worked) and no leadership (but the ones that haven't worked)...and the beat goes on. When have tax cuts not worked? They worked as implemented by Reagan in '82 when the economy was worse than it is now, everyone seems to "conveniently" forget that. The current economy only started its downward spiral, (which has only vastly accelerated under The One, btw), after the Fed Gubmint got involved, (first under GW Bush). I opposed GW's "stimulus" bills last year just as much as I oppose B.O.'s current grotesquely more expensive "stimulus" plans. Oh let's see, when have tax cuts not worked...how about for the last 8 years! OK, they worked well for the top 2% of the population but it's sucked for the rest of us. As to you're comment regarding Obama crashing the economy...do you really think ANYONE will take you seriously? ROFLMAO!!! ROFLMAO all you want, but can you HONESTLY say that your happy with what your seeing going on with this "adminstration"? Happy is a relative term; compared to what? There are NO politicians I completely trust. What I have seen so far is an administration that seems to recognize and admit there is a problem. An administration that is willing to take bold action to address it (IMHO not bold enough), but certainly an improvement over the last 8 years. I see what appears to be a significant change in economic policy to include oversight and perhaps re-regulation of financial markets (something long overdue and IMHO the basic cause of our economic woes). So to answer your question “am I happy”, no but I am hopeful.

content: quote: Originally posted by BPCR45_90: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: "http://gatewaypundit.blogspot.com/2009/03/obama-popularity-plunges-down-22-points.html" The highly accurate poll subtracts the ‘strong dissapprovals’ from the ‘strong approvals’ to get their net approval rating. The week Barack Obama was sworn in, the ‘Obama Approval Index’ his approval rate was a whopping 30%. By March 1 to a meager 8%. Considering he had 15% on February 27, this is a veritable freefall. "Highly accurate" my azz. What a load of BS! Obama's already high approval rating went up a bit to 68% during his 6 weeks in office, according to the bipartisan NBC News / Wall Street Journal poll released yesterday(3/3/09). Thursday, March 05, 2009 Rasmussen Reports daily Presidential Tracking Poll for Thursday shows that 41% of the nation’s voters now Strongly Approve of the way that Barack Obama is performing his role as President. Twenty-seven percent (27%) Strongly Disapprove to give Obama a Presidential Approval Index rating of +14 (see trends). Thirty-five percent (35%) of voters now say the nation is heading in the right direction. That’s up from 30% a week ago and 28% the week before. Seventy-two percent (72%) of Democrats Strongly Approve of the President’s performance while 52% of Republicans Strongly Disapprove. Voters not affiliated with either major party are fairly evenly divided (see other recent demographic highlights). The Presidential Approval Index is calculated by subtracting the number who Strongly Disapprove from the number who Strongly Approve. It is updated daily at 9:30 a.m. Eastern (sign up for free daily e-mail update). Updates also available on Twitter. Please take a moment to predict where the President’s Approval Index ratings will be at the end of his first 100 days in office. Overall, 59% of voters say they at least somewhat approve of the President’s performance so far while 40% disapprove. For more measures, see Obama By the Numbers. As you can see they take the approval and subtract out the disapproval to get their number. So you are correct in saying that it may be a 68% approval, but once you subtract out the disapproval...it ain't so good. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: It seems to me, Obama is facing the international test (or crisis) that Biden predicted would happen! He has three "Leaky Boats" (for the lack of a better methpor) to deal with! - One Leaky Boat is the U.S. Economy and the Loss of Jobs. - This President is doing nothing (except making the leaks worse) to improve this situation. - Potential INVESTORS in our markets and/or new businesses cannot find any reason to have confidence in any of Obama's actions. - The President "Talks Down" the American Economy for whatever reason. No reason for Investor confidence on that situation. - To date, all of Obama's proposals offer little reason for Investor confidence - literally no tax breaks for businesses owners and/or potential EMPLOYERS. The second "leaky boat" is the United States Stature or Prestige abroad. - Many allied countries had invested in the United States' markets and banks. - Those investors have LOST HEAVILY. - Nothing, relating to solving that part of the crisis, is happening. - Those Nations are "Pi##ed at America and rightfully so! - Sec of State Clinton quickly traveled to Japan and China to try to "quiet" their complaints. She's doing the same in Europe and Russia. - This Presidental "letter Writing" to Russia is highly unusual and "Smells of Appeasement." Appeasement with our Enemies is not going to bring us better PROTECTION or Security. Appeasement will cause our ememies to hold America in "MORE CONTEMPT and demand more concessions from us! - Other Nations Have No Confidence" in the LARGE STIMULUS (e.g., Spending Bill) we just placed on our Children to pay back! The third leaky boat is: - the crisis on our border with Mexico. - this is a grave threat to America's security. - The Administration, if they are really doing any thing of importance, to quell or stop this; it's not being disclosed! Instead, Obama seems to be pushing health care reform (that we can do without change right now) and planning parties at the White House! Those that choose to ADMIRE him will continue with their right to do so! Me; I'll proudly continue to oppose him; for those reasons mentioned above and NUMEROUS other reasons! All are my opinion! From A Proud Vietnam Veteran

Obama Said: "I will cut tens of billions of dollars in wasteful spending. I will cut investments in unproven missile defense systems. I will not weaponize space. content: quote: Originally posted by BPCR45_90: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: "http://gatewaypundit.blogspot.com/2009/03/obama-popularity-plunges-down-22-points.html" The highly accurate poll subtracts the ‘strong dissapprovals’ from the ‘strong approvals’ to get their net approval rating. The week Barack Obama was sworn in, the ‘Obama Approval Index’ his approval rate was a whopping 30%. By March 1 to a meager 8%. Considering he had 15% on February 27, this is a veritable freefall. "Highly accurate" my azz. What a load of BS! Obama's already high approval rating went up a bit to 68% during his 6 weeks in office, according to the bipartisan NBC News / Wall Street Journal poll released yesterday(3/3/09). Thursday, March 05, 2009 Rasmussen Reports daily Presidential Tracking Poll for Thursday shows that 41% of the nation’s voters now Strongly Approve of the way that Barack Obama is performing his role as President. Twenty-seven percent (27%) Strongly Disapprove to give Obama a Presidential Approval Index rating of +14 (see trends). Thirty-five percent (35%) of voters now say the nation is heading in the right direction. That’s up from 30% a week ago and 28% the week before. Seventy-two percent (72%) of Democrats Strongly Approve of the President’s performance while 52% of Republicans Strongly Disapprove. Voters not affiliated with either major party are fairly evenly divided (see other recent demographic highlights). The Presidential Approval Index is calculated by subtracting the number who Strongly Disapprove from the number who Strongly Approve. It is updated daily at 9:30 a.m. Eastern (sign up for free daily e-mail update). Updates also available on Twitter. Please take a moment to predict where the President’s Approval Index ratings will be at the end of his first 100 days in office. Overall, 59% of voters say they at least somewhat approve of the President’s performance so far while 40% disapprove. For more measures, see Obama By the Numbers. As you can see they take the approval and subtract out the disapproval to get their number. So you are correct in saying that it may be a 68% approval, but once you subtract out the disapproval...it ain't so good. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: It seems to me, Obama is facing the international test (or crisis) that Biden predicted would happen! He has three "Leaky Boats" (for the lack of a better methpor) to deal with! - One Leaky Boat is the U.S. Economy and the Loss of Jobs. - This President is doing nothing (except making the leaks worse) to improve this situation. - Potential INVESTORS in our markets and/or new businesses cannot find any reason to have confidence in any of Obama's actions. - The President "Talks Down" the American Economy for whatever reason. No reason for Investor confidence on that situation. - To date, all of Obama's proposals offer little reason for Investor confidence - literally no tax breaks for businesses owners and/or potential EMPLOYERS. The second "leaky boat" is the United States Stature or Prestige abroad. - Many allied countries had invested in the United States' markets and banks. - Those investors have LOST HEAVILY. - Nothing, relating to solving that part of the crisis, is happening. - Those Nations are "Pi##ed at America and rightfully so! - Sec of State Clinton quickly traveled to Japan and China to try to "quiet" their complaints. She's doing the same in Europe and Russia. - This Presidental "letter Writing" to Russia is highly unusual and "Smells of Appeasement." Appeasement with our Enemies is not going to bring us better PROTECTION or Security. Appeasement will cause our ememies to hold America in "MORE CONTEMPT and demand more concessions from us! - Other Nations Have No Confidence" in the LARGE STIMULUS (e.g., Spending Bill) we just placed on our Children to pay back!
